name: Spl-assignment1
body:
### About
This assignment was made as part of the SPL (Systems Programming Course) at BGU university. Assignment Instructions 
[Assignment Instructions](http://www.cs.bgu.ac.il/~spl161/wiki.files/spl161_hw1v1.2.pdf)

### Main Objective
Correct memory management handling in C++.
This assignment simulates a 'cyber-security' attack. Firstly reading xml configuration files and setting up a network of 'computers'.
After the building of the network the simulations iterates over the events xml file until termination time, executing events of the types:
• Clock-In events (Cyber expert started working)
• Hack events (A specific computer is hacked)
• Cleaning events (Cyber expert succeded in removing a worm)
• Infection events (A worm has infected a certain computer)
• Termination events
